intro: Anchietea frangulifolia, commonly known as the Portuguese heath, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Azores and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in coastal or mountainous areas. It is often found in open woodlands and heathlands, where it forms dense, low shrubs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
